intro: Chiococca racemosa, commonly known as the Brazilian cherry or Brazilian rosewood, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its dense, aromatic foliage and showy, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as a small tree or shrub, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are opposite, elliptical, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are usually white or pink. The fruit is a small, fleshy drupe that contains a single seed.
